title: 104_hr2885
content: The Act may be cited as the "Use of Assisted Housing by Aliens Act of 1995". Actions in cases of termination of financial assistance are outlined. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1980 is amended to require financial assistance for families on a prorated basis and limit assistance to a single 3-month period. The amendment to the Housing and Community Development Act of 1980 limits financial assistance to a single 3-month period and applies to any deferral granted on or after the enactment date, with restrictions on renewals for deferrals granted before the enactment date. SEC. 3. Verification of immigration status and eligibility for financial assistance. Section 214(d) of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1980 is amended to include verification requirements for citizenship status when applying for financial assistance. The Secretary may not provide assistance for an individual before proper documentation is presented and verified. Assistance may not be delayed, denied, reduced, or terminated based on immigration status for individuals already receiving aid, with a 30-day grace period provided. Assistance may not be delayed, denied, reduced, or terminated based on immigration status for individuals already receiving aid, with a 30-day grace period provided for verification or appeal. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1980 is amended to include verification requirements for citizenship status when applying for financial assistance. The Secretary can deny financial assistance or terminate eligibility based on immigration status. The Secretary can terminate financial assistance eligibility for up to 24 months if an individual knowingly allows an ineligible person to use the assistance. SEC. 4. PROHIBITION OF SANCTIONS AGAINST ENTITIES MAKING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE ELIGIBILITY DETERMINATIONS. Section 214(e)(4) of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1980 is amended to remove paragraph (4). SEC. 5. SUSPENSION OF IMPLEMENTATION OF REGULATIONS. The regulations on assistance to noncitizens issued by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development in 1995 will not be enforced after April 1, 1996. Any new regulations must align with the Housing and Community Development Act of 1980.
